News.headline: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Guiseley AFC
News.page_title: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Guiseley AFC
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Guiseley AFC
News.short_description: Dagenham & Redbridge saw their five game winning streak come to an end with a 2-1 loss at home to Guiseley in the National League.
News.description:
Daggers made just one change from the win at Southport, with Ray Grant coming in for a debut at the expense of Frankie Raymond.

Daggers fell behind in the 12th minute when Guiseley forward Jordan Preston curled a low effort past Elliot Justham from 18 yards.

Three minutes later, Daggers were reduced to 10 men after Corey Whitely was sent off for violent conduct.

Daggers went close to fashioning a way back into the match, with Oliver Hawkins narrowly missing two chances inside 60 seconds 10 minutes later.

In stoppage time at the end of the first half, Daggers were awarded a penalty after Marcus Williams handled in the box, but Jordan Maguire-Drew saw the resulting spot-kick saved.

Daggers fell further behind in the 52nd minute when Preston powerfully struck his second of the match.

Daggers pulled one back in stoppage time when striker Oliver Hawkins converted a Joe Widdowson cross.

Attendance: 2055 (32 away fans)

Line Ups:
Daggers: Justham, Widdowson, Robson, Okenabirhie (Benson, 61 mins), Hawkins, Maguire-Drew (Howells, 67 mins), Boucaud, Whitely, Grant (Doe, 45 mins), Donnellan, Sheppard

Guiseley: Maxted, Brown, Lowe, Lawlor, Hatfield, Rooney, Preston (Boyes, 82 mins), Williams, Walton, Cassidy (Rankine, 74 mins), Asamoah (Logan, 90 mins)
